searchtree
Class SearchTree

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--searchtree.SearchTree
public class SearchTree
extends java.lang.Object

This class is a facade for packages tree and its inorder iterator. It also enforces the "searchness" of trees, i.e., the condition that, recursively, the decorations of the left child precedes the root and the root precedes the decorations of the right child.

The implementation has characteristics of Delegation (the class delegates most operations to class BinaryTree), Adapter (the class modifies the signature of some methods), and Proxy (the class performs similarly to BinaryTree, but hides some of its operations).

Constructor Summary

          Construct a search tree with no decorations.

Method Detail

insert

public void insert(java.lang.Comparable x)
Insert an element into in this search tree. Elements in a tree are unique. Inserting an element that is already in a tree has no effect.
Parameters:
x - The element to insert in a tree.

print

public void print()
Pretty print this tree. Rotate 90 deg clockwise to look at the output.

elementsInOrder

public java.util.Enumeration elementsInOrder()
Return an interator to enumerate this tree's elements in inorder.
